text:
NAJEB - VOA Project
STRESS—RHYTHM—INTONATION SERIES
Outline
1. Basic statement intonation; rhythm drills*
2# Basic yes/no question; statement with final rise («?)•
3. Basic information question, and basic answers*
4o Review of above 3 lessons*
5* Vocatives, prefatory remarks, exclamations, greetings.
6* Suggestions, commands, requests.
7. Question tags.
8* Question tag in middle of sentence.
9* Reported speech & direct quotations.
10* Relayed speech; inserted parenthetical phvases*
11* Constructions with because and if; restrictive &
non-restrictive constructions; phonemic intonation*
12* Same as 11.
13. Contrastive stress.
14. Series (with & without series intonation).
15. Shift of stress for meaing (including stress on auxiliary).
16. Same as 15.
17. Two-word verbs and nouns derived therefrom.
18. Same as 17.
19. Noun adjunct (contrasted with adiective + noun and
literary use of noun + adjective).
20.
Same as 19
